ratings.comment: If you have a class with this professor, DROP NOW. He constantly makes mistakes on the board, explains things that are irrelevant to the class expects you to know random info for the exams. I dropped this class b/c I was failing and took again w/ a different professor and received an A.

I went and met with this professor, and as a person he was very nice and interested in my struggles and progress as a student.  However, as a teacher, the way the class was taught didn't make sense, he was hard to understand, and was self proclaimed to be falling "deeper and deeper into his senescence". Also, my TA barely spoke english.

This guy makes you prove a lot of theorems. He also put on the midterm i just took something that nobody knew what to do with. The secant concavity theorem. He gave a list of proofs he said might appear on the exam the week before the midterm, but this was not one of them. I had to leave the page blank.
Didn't understand a thing from lecture.

hands down worst professor i've ever had. extremely unorganized, unhelpful, and does not know how to teach what he is supposed to be teaching. the board is a mess when he writes on it, and he constantly erases notes because students always find errors in his work. avoid if possible, if not, be prepared to learn yourself.

THIS GUY CAN'T TEACH (and he admits it too)! Must learn the material on your own...and he misses appointments. I am very lucky to have a good TA; otherwise I would have flunk this class already. If you need this material own the road, AVOID AT ALL COST....

I ended up working really hard to get an AB...If you take this class you have to be adept at teaching yourself the material.  Make sure you have a good TA because it is almost impossible to learn from the lectures and the notes provided...If possible I would take this class from a different professor.  He is a nice guy but he isn't the best teacher

Horrible, avoid at all costs. I have always liked math until I took his class. Never uses the book and his lectures will just confuse you. Smart guy but he should definitely not be teaching this course.

Had him for 221&222. Wow,it's been a love hate relatnshp with this guy. He really is a nice guy but wow sometimes its too much. Perpetual confusion. Hands out "lecture notes"-HW problems in it are ridiculous...to the point where your performance in the class rides completely on the level of your TA's competence/level of caring. One midterm, 40%=D/F
Lectures are almost pointless, the guy makes so many mistakes, the only reason I might do OK in the class is because of my awesome TA Kostas. Definitely look elsewhere for a Math 222 Prof.

I Love math & was looking forward to calc. I had already taken HS calc before& we learned the same exact things i had learned the previous yr, Yet I managed to do horrible on the exams. Lectures were pointless, I went to every single one &it didnt help.  Some people do well in his class, but if you don't NATURALLy get math, DON"T take with JOEL

At first i didn't not like Robbin at all. He is confusing in lecture but if you go everyday and stop by his office hours when you're confused you can get great grades. He's such a nice guy, funny, and sweet.  Don't be shy to stop by his office and have him clarify. Getting a good TA helps too. His tests are very easy if you do all the homework.

The nice thing about taking Robbin, is that you dont need to go to lecture. He just gets confused and in turn confuses you much more. I just learned from the book. He's a nice guy, but he shouldn't teach.

You could tell Joel really cared about his students, but he was not a good lecturer. He constantly made mistakes and would start over just to do it wrong again, so he was hard to follow. He does however have great lecture notes and his tests are fair and not bad if you do the homework. If you have a good TA, his class is doable...

Avoid this guy at all costs.  His lectures are completely pointless.  I stopped going to them after a month of going and sleeping through every single one.  His tests are very hard, but graded on a curve so it doesn't really matter.  There is no required homework either.  It's hard to do well in a class where the professor rambles through lectures.
he cant teach for****
Joel isn't very clear, he confused me on things I already knew how to do and gets confused easily.  Tests aren't too hard if you don't listen to him and learn from your TA.

Professor Robbin goes off on tangents a lot.  Very unclear and made mistakes all the time in lecture. It was so hard to stay awake and pay attention that i decided not to attend lecture. I ended up doing very poorly in the class, but at least he dropped one of three midterm grades. I would try and take this class with a different prof.

Prof. Robbins is like a jolly grandpa but not one who does a good job at teaching math. I freaked out at the beginning of the semester until I realized that it wasn't my fault that I was confused and lost. Lectures are pretty pointless expect to find out what you need to read in the textbook for. The tests are not insanely hard though.

The class is extremely unorganized.  You're better off learning from the book than trying to decipher what the prof just said in lecture.  He once spent an entire 1 hour 15 minute lecture on one problem that he claimed was ambiguous.  He constantly changes his syllabus, but doesn't update it properly, so good luck knowing what your grade is.

All I can say is AVOID.  His lectures consist of incoherent ramblings, incorrect calculations, and continual contradictions.  He changed the course requirements about 10 times throughout the semester and our class would receive weekly e-mails from him with the subject of "oops", detailing another "errata" as he calls it.

Prof. Robbin is very unclear in his teaching style because he can never stay on the same topic for more than 20 seconds.  He makes quite a few simple algebra mistakes in lecture as well.  I advise not taking him if you would like to keep your interest in math.
No Comments
Essentially, if you've had calc before, take him. If not, look elsewhere.

If you have had the class in high school, Robbin is pretty good; he breaks off on tangents easily, and he has a tendency to fail at the algebra.  He has no homework, but he did mention that in the future he will not drop the lowest midterm.

Never take a class with him. the only reason he has a rating above absolute zero is because all the girls in the class think he is a cute old man. in reality he is a senial old man who has no direction in his lectures and runs off on random tangents all the time. you would be better staying at home and learning the material on your own

you get to drop a whole midterm because the man can't teach. can. not. teach.  if you've taken calc before and did well, oh then maybe you can do it.  if not, have fun trying to figure it out.  this class raised my level of hatred of math to an unprecedented high.  if i could throw rotten food at him in lecture i would.

ok, so this guy is very smart, but not such a great teacher....he went to harvard, so i'm pretty sure he's competent...he's just an awkward prof.  but he IS does a lot for students as far as making the class bearable.  i LOVE him as a person, but not as a prof.

i dont know what other ppl are talking about, but if you've had calc before, and are somewhat competent in the material, this class is AMAZING. its so easy no HW at all, test are easy and you get to drop a whole midterm. Way better than Raam's 100 prob HW per week. if you havent had calc before do not take him because hes a terrible teacher
cant teach.
Try and avoid this professor.  He tends to make many mistakes on the board and is very unclear.  If it weren't for a really good TA I would not have done very well in this class.
Not a very good prof.  He is very confusing and makes you proove everything.  Lecs are pointless.
Robbin does not do a very good job explaining problems to the students.  He makes several mistakes on the board, which makes it hard to follow what he is doing.

I understood nothing he said during lecture.  The book was my teacher.  he is empathetic to students.  He is too smart to teach material to students that have no idea what he talking about.  The test were bearable.

if you need your QB take this prof. i didn't study more than an hour the whole semester, i got a BC but c'mon where else can you leave PAGES blank on a tests and still pass the class. do a little more and you'll do a little better.  the stuff isn't easy and his lectures are pointless to go to because he makes no sense but yea take him if you need i
No Comments
Good prof. A bit unorganized but helpful and empathetic to students. Very smart. Wide range of knowledge.
I liked him.. what other calc professor will grade tests on effort!?  He is the best Math prof. I've had.
HE is a horrible lecturer. the only thing that helped is he had really good TA's
Everybody needs to chill - good math profs teach nothing but proofs. Thats math...I would recommend him b/c calc is not going to get any easier.
This old hag should be really be six feet under by now, but instead he's teaching calc at UW-Madison.  This class is the equilvalent of a polio outbreak - stay away!

Everyone is more or less right. If I hadn't had calc in highschool, I would be completely lost because his teaching is a bit unclear. The tests are hard because he rarely puts specific problems on there. Class isn't bad...but the teaching style is.

His teaching style is very sloppy and disorganized. But, if you took calc in HS, you'll do fine. Just read the book if you're confused. He gives the easiest grading curves I've ever had.  He's always willing to answer any questions you have.
unclear and makes mistakes during lecture, not good if you dont understand calculus.
He is stupid
he's such a cute older guy! a funny sense of humor. and i think i learn more in lecture than in discussion. plus his curves are really forgiving. i like him

This guy was unbelievable.  He was so bad, not helpful, made tons of mistakes and wasn't clear as to what was going to be on the exam at all.  If you take this class you are set up for failure, run and hide if he is your teacher
He's a stud.
No Comments
I would have learned more from this class if it was taught by a monkey. I think administration should consider it if they are going to keep Robbin around.

By far the worst excuse for a teacher i have ever seen. If there were negative scores he would recieve them across the board. By going to his lectures i feel more stupid than i did before going to them. If only there was more room to write bad things.

Honestly, Prof. Robbin is the worst teacher I have ever had.  Everything on the other reviews are exactly correct.  He is unclear... and is a terrible teacher.  If you go to talk to him and ask questions he will yell at you and try to avoid talking to you

Professor Robbin has to be the worst teacher on the University of Wisconsin- Madison Camups. He doesn't know how to teach, and he doens't know what he is teaching. He will do problems with the class, and he does the problems wrong. How can we learn!?
This guy needs to retire.  He should have 15 years ago.  Lecture is worthless to go to.  I personally got dumber if i went.  The tests have nothing to do with anything he talks about ever.

Doesn't explain things all too well, and makes an *exceptional* number of mistakes on the board.  BUT... he's certainly entertaining and can capture your attention than most other math profs!  Tests fairly difficult.

Had the choice between 461 & 565.  I picked geometry because I used to love it.  BIG MISTAKE.  Homework has nothing to do with lecture, exams have nothing to do with homework, does not have a semester outline (even in rough form), completely disorganized,
Doesn't make any sense.  Horrible lecturer.  Never does any examples.  Gives long assignments.
